abstract.text: We present recent results on charmonium and charmonium-like states from the BaBar B-factory located at the PEP-II asymmetric energy e + e − storage ring at the SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory.

body_text.text: INTRODUCTION
The charmonium spectroscopy has been revitalized by the discovery of many new states above the open charm threshold.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: While some of them appear to be consistent with conventional charmonium others don't seem to behave like standard meson and could be made of a larger number of constituent quarks.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: While this possibility has been considered since the beginning of the standard model, the clear identification of such states would represent a major revolution in the picture of the quark model.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: The possible interpretations of these states beyond the conventional mesons are:
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: • molecules: these are loosely bound states of a pair of mesons ([Qq][q Q ]) [1].
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: This system would be stable if the binding energy were to set the mass of the states below the sum of the two meson masses.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: The dominant binding mechanism of this state is pion exchange.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: • tetraquarks: a bound state of four quarks usually represented as ([Qq][q Q]) [2].
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: Strong decays proceed via rearrangement processes.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: This interpretation predicts many new states and the existence of states with non-zero charge.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: • hybrids: a bound state of a quark-antiquark pair and a number of constituent gluons.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: The lowest-lying state from lattice calculation is expected have mass about 4.1 GeV/c 2 [3].
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: While states with exotic quantum number such (0 +− , 1 −+ , 2 +− ) are unambiguos hybrids other states can be distinguished from the conventional hadrons by characteristics of their decay process.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: In addition there is the possibility that some observed enhancements are simply due to threshold effect: a given amplitude might be magnified when new hadronic final states become energetically available.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: Even if several experiments [4] have performed many measurements of these charmonium-like states the overall picture is not clear.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: In the next section we will review recent BABAR results on this field.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: arXiv:1208.6466v1 [hep-ex] 31 Aug 2012
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: CHARMONIUM PRODUCTION @ THE B-FACTORIES
The B-factories are an ideal place to study charmonium since charmonium states are copiously produced in a variety of processes:
body_text.section: CHARMONIUM PRODUCTION @ THE B-FACTORIES

body_text.text: • B decays: B mesons decay to charmonium in about 3% of cases.
body_text.section: CHARMONIUM PRODUCTION @ THE B-FACTORIES

body_text.text: Charmonium states of any quantum number can be produced.
body_text.section: CHARMONIUM PRODUCTION @ THE B-FACTORIES

body_text.text: • Double-charmonium production: in this process, observed for the first time by Belle [5], a J/ψ or a ψ(2S) is produced together and exclusively with another charmonium state.
body_text.section: CHARMONIUM PRODUCTION @ THE B-FACTORIES

body_text.text: • γγ fusion: two virtual photons are emitted by the colliding e + e − pair (e + e − → e + e − γ * γ * → e + e − (cc)).
body_text.section: CHARMONIUM PRODUCTION @ THE B-FACTORIES

body_text.text: States with C=+1 are formed.
body_text.section: CHARMONIUM PRODUCTION @ THE B-FACTORIES

body_text.text: • Initial state radiation (ISR): where a photon is emitted by the incoming electron or positron (e + e − → γ(cc)), only states with J PC = 1 −− are formed.
body_text.section: CHARMONIUM PRODUCTION @ THE B-FACTORIES

body_text.text: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.
The Y(3940) was observed for the first time by Belle [6] in B decays and then confirmed by BABAR [7].
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: In a re-analysis [8] of the BABAR data sample the precision of the Y(3940) parameters was improved and in addition evidence for the decay X(3872) → J/ψω was found.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: This confirmed an earlier Belle claim [9] for the existence of this decay mode.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: A subsequent Belle paper [10] reports the evidence of a structure in the process γγ → J/ψω that they dubbed the X(3915) with mass and width values similar to those obtained for the Y(3940) by BABAR [7].
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: BABAR has recently performed a study of the process γγ → J/ψω [11] to search for the X(3915) and the X(3872) using a data sample of 519 fb −1 .
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: Figure 1 shows the reconstructed J/ψω mass distribution after all the selection criteria have been applied.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: A large peak at near 3915 MeV /c 2 is observed with a significance of 7.6 σ .
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: The measured resonance's parameters obtained from a maximum likelihood fit are m X(3915) = (3919.4 ± 2.2 ± 1.6)MeV /c 2 , Γ X(3915) = (13 ± 6 ± 3)MeV.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: The measured value of the two-photon width times the branching fraction, is Γ γγ (X(3915) × B(X(3915) → J/ψω) = 52 ± 10 ± 3 eV and (10.5 ± 1.9 ± 0.6) eV for the spin hypothesis J=0 and J=2, respectively, where the first error is statistical and the second is systematic.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: In addition a Bayesian upper limit (UL) at 90 % confidence level (CL) is obtained for the X(3872):
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: Studies of charmonium like-states in recent years have been performed using mainly the J/ψπ + π − final state, no search using the η c π + π − final state has been conducted.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: Such a search may shed light on the quantum numbers of the charmonium-like-particle or the internal dynamics of these states.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: In particular, it has been suggested that if the X(3872) is the 1 1 D 2 state η c2 then the branching fraction B(X(3872) → η c π + π − ) could be significantly larger than B(X(3872) → J/ψπ + π − ).
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: The quantum numbers  the η c2 are consistent with the results of an angular analysis of X(3872) → J/ψπ + π − [12] and would allow production of X(3872) in two-photon fusion.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: BABAR using 474 fb −1 studied the process γγ → X → η c π + π − [13] where X stands for one of the resonance χ c2 (1P), η c2 (2S), X(3872), X(3915) or χ c2 (2P).
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: The η c was reconstructed via its decay to K 0 S K + π − , with K 0 S → π + π − .
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: The signal yield for each X resonance is extracted from a two-dimensional fit to m(K 0 S K + π − ) and m(K S K + π − π + π − ).
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: Figure 2 presents the two dimensional fits around each of the resonances.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: No significant signal is observed in any of the fits.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: Results of the γγ → η c π + π − fits.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: For each resonance X, we show the peak mass and width used in the fit and the 90% CL upper limit on the product of the two-photon partial width Γ γγ and the X → η c ππ branching fraction.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: For the X(3872) and the X(3915) we assume J = 2.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: Resonances  [19].
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: These new structures were labeled as the Z 1 (4050) + and Z 2 (4250) + , both decaying to χ c1 π + .
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: BABAR using a data sample of 429 fb −1 has recent searched for the Z 1 (4050) + and Z 2 (4250) + in the processB 0 → χ c1 K − π + and in the decay B + → K 0 s χ c1 π + [20]; with the χ c1 → J/ψγ.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: In the BABAR analysis the χ c1 π + mass distribution, after background subtraction and efficiency-correction, has been modeled using the angular information from the Kπ mass distribution that has been represented using the Legendre polynomial moments.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: The excellent description of the χ c1 π + mass distribution given by this analysis approach shows that there is no need for any additional resonance to model the distribution.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: Figure 3 shows the result of the fit done on the χ c1 π + mass spectrum using two or one scalar Breit-Wigners with parameters fixed to the Belle measurement.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: In all the fit cases there are no significant resonant structure, the statistical significance obtained is very low < 2σ .
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: The ULs on the 90 % CL on the branching fractions are for the one resonance fit: for the two resonances fit are:
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: STUDY OF THE J/ψπ + π − SYSTEM VIA INITIAL STATE RADIATION (ISR).
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: In 2005 BABAR discovered the Y(4260) in the process e + e − → γ ISR Y (4260), with the Y (4260) → J/ψπ + π − [21].
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: Since it is produced directly in e + e − annihilation it has J PC = 1 −− .
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: The observation of the decay mode J/ψπ 0 π 0 [22] established that it has zero isospin.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: However it is not observed to decay to D * D * [23], nor to D * sD * s [24], so that its properties do not lend themselves to a simple charmonium interpretation, and its nature is still unclear.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: A subsequent Belle analysis [25] of the same final state suggested also the existence of an additional resonance around 4.1 GeV/c 2 that they dubbed the Y(4008).
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: BABAR has performed recently a new analysis [26] of this process using 454 fb −1 .
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: In this new study the region below 4.0 GeV /c 2 has been studied for the first time.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: As shown on Figure 4
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: (a) in that region there is an excess of events above the J/ψ sidebands background.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: To understand the nature of this contribution a detailed study of the ψ(2S) line shape has been performed and the results is that it is not possible to discount the possibility that its due to J/ψπ + π − continuum cross section in this region.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: Figure 4(a) shows the fit to the J/ψπ + π − mass distribution.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: A clear signal for the Y(4260) is seen; the values obtained from an unbinned-maximumlikelihood fit are: m Y (4260) = 4244 ± 5 ± 4 MeV /c 2 , Γ Y (4260) = 114 +16 −15 ± 7 MeV and Γ ee × B(J/ψπ + π − ) = 9.2 ± 0.8 ± 0.7eV.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: There is no evidence for the Y(4008) seen by  Belle [25].
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: In the new BABAR analysis a detailed study of the π + π − system from the Y(4260) decay to J/ψπ + π − has been performed.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: The π + π − mass distribution shown on Figure  4
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: (b) seems to peak around the f 0 (980) mass; however the peak is displaced from the nominal f 0 (980) position, since it is around 940 MeV /c 2 .
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: The fact that the peak is displaced and the particular shape of m(π + π − ) distribution seems to suggest a possible interference between the f 0 (980) and m(π + π − ) continuum.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: To test this possibility the f 0 (980) line shape is taken from the BABAR analysis of the D + S → π + π − π + [27] and this amplitude as been used in a very simple model to describe the π + π − mass distribution: | √ pol + e iφ F f 0 (980) | 2 where pol is a polynomial function used to describe the m(π + π − ) continuum and F f 0 (980) is the amplitude from the D + S → π + π − π + [27] analysis; φ allows for a phase difference between these amplitudes.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: The result of this study is shown on Figure 4
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: (b) and indicates if there is a real f 0 (980) contribution to the decay of the Y(4260) to J/ψπ + π − its contribution is not dominant:
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE J/ψω IN TWO-PHOTON INTERACTIONS.

body_text.text: STUDY OF THE ψ(2S)π + π − SYSTEM VIA INITIAL STATE RADIATION (ISR).
In addition to the Y(4260), two more J PC = 1 −− states, the Y(4360) and the Y(4660) have been reported in ISR production e + e − → ψ(2S)π + π − [28], [29].
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE ψ(2S)π + π − SYSTEM VIA INITIAL STATE RADIATION (ISR).

body_text.text: While the Y(4360) was discovered by BABAR [28] and then confirmed by Belle [29] the Y(4660) was only observed by the Belle Collaboration.
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE ψ(2S)π + π − SYSTEM VIA INITIAL STATE RADIATION (ISR).

body_text.text: BABAR performed a new analysis using all its available dataset collected ad the ϒ(nS), n=2,3,4; that corresponds to an integrated luminosity of 520fb −1 .
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE ψ(2S)π + π − SYSTEM VIA INITIAL STATE RADIATION (ISR).

body_text.text: The ψ(2S)π + π − mass spectrum for the ψ(2S) → J/ψπ + π − is reported in Figure 5
body_text.section: STUDY OF THE ψ(2S)π + π − SYSTEM VIA INITIAL STATE RADIATION (ISR).
